name: Bogey '77
description:
This game contains flashing images.

Made using batariBasic by Random Terrain and the Atari Dev Studio by chunkypixel.

/////DESCRIPTION/////

Welcome to Bogey '77! With 10 holes to play, you're bound to have countless minutes of fun! Can you beat all 10 holes and prove, once and for all that you are Golf?

/////HOW TO PLAY/////

1. Power Indicator (purple) & Power Meter (white)

2. Ball (white) & Direction Pip (black)

3. Hole

Each stroke is split into two parts, selecting Stroke direction and Stroke strength.

When selecting stroke direction, using the left and right stick control moves the pip counter-clockwise or clockwise respectively. When you've aimed correctly press and hold to move onto the next part.

Once pressed, the game will move onto selecting stroke strength. The Indicator (1, purple) will move along the top of the screen. The background will change colors as well to indicate the strength of the stroke in a sequence of colors from blue to red, with stroke strength increasing the farther right the indicator goes. When ready, release the fire button.

Once direction and strength are selected, the ball will move in the indicated direction according to the strength of the stroke. At some point the ball will stop, and move to the next stroke.

Once the ball enters the hole, the game moves onto the next hole on the first stroke.

/////CONTROLS/////

Left/Right - Move direction pip.

Fire Button/Button 0 - Increases swing power.

Game Reset - Restarts game at Hole 0.
